intro: Adesmia volckmannii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including grasslands and disturbed soils. Adesmia volckmannii is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
